content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide up-to-date full organisational structure charts in a digital format (pdf) for the following departments:
City Futures
Investment, Climate Change and Planning
Planning Department
Neighbourhood Services
Street Scene and Regulation
Waste Management Department
Neighbourhood Services
Street Scene and Regulation
Highways Maintenance Department
Neighbourhood Services
Street Scene and Regulation
Street Scene and Parking Services Department
Neighbourhood Services
Street Scene and Regulation
Environmental Regulation and Licensing
Licensing Department
Neighbourhood Services
Street Scene and Regulation
Environmental Regulation and Licensing
Health Protection Department
Neighbourhood Services
Street Scene and Regulation
Environmental Regulation and Licensing
Environmental Protection Department
Neighbourhood Services
Street Scene and Regulation
Environmental Regulation and Licensing
Noise and Nuisance Department (Including Night Time Enforcement Officers)
Please include all names (redacted) and job titles from the Executive Director to all officers including any technical, protection & enforcement officers.
If any of the above departments are divided into smaller Sub-Areas within Sheffield Local Authority Area then please include these within the organisational structure charts.
Please provide a separate chart for each department.
Could you also provide the names (not redacted) and contact work emails for the following managers:
Head of Democratic Services
Head of Strategic Transport Sustainability and Infrastructure
Head of Planning
Head of Highways Maintenance
Head of Street Scene
Head of Environmental Regulation and Licensing
Head of Community Safety
Yours faithfully,
Mark Booth

Dear Mark Booth,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Organisational
Structure Chart - Sheffield Licensing-Planning-Highways-Noise which we
received on 28/04/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 28/05/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail
References
Visible links
1. mailto:[Sheffield City Council request email]

6 Attachments

Dear Mark Booth,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Organisational
Structure Chart - Sheffield Licensing-Planning-Highways-Noise which we
received on 28/04/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Please see attached.
The information you have requested in relation to names, individual email
addresses and telephone numbers is exempt from disclosure under section
40(2) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 on the grounds that it is
personal data and disclosure would contravene the data protection
principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection Regulation
that processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and transparent.
Further information can be accessed at the following link: [1]Sheffield
City Council management teams | Sheffield City Council
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [4][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: FOI
Sent: Monday, April 29, 2024 4:25 PM
To: Mark Booth <[FOI #1124781 email]>
Subject: Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 1115839
Dear Mark Booth,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Organisational

This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt

Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
